com.bitplane.xt.options

Interface ImarisCacheOptions<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    org.scijava.optional.Options<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ImarisCachedCellImgOptions, ImarisDatasetOptions

    public interface ImarisCacheOptions<T>
extends org.scijava.optional.Options<T>
    Optional arguments that specify the cache behaviour of ImarisCachedCellImg or ImarisDataset.
    Author:
    Tobias Pietzsch

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  ImarisCacheOptions.Val

        setValue

    • Method Detail

      • numIoThreads

        default T numIoThreads(int numIoThreads)
        The specified number of threads is started to handle asynchronous writing of values that are evicted from the memory cache.
        Parameters:
        numIoThreads - how many writer threads to start (default is 1).

      • maxIoQueueSize

        default T maxIoQueueSize(int maxIoQueueSize)
        Set the maximum size of the disk write queue. When the queue is full, removing entries from the cache will block until earlier values have been written.

        Because processing of removed entries is done whenever the cache is accessed, this may also block accesses to the cache. (This is a good thing, because it avoids running out of memory because entries cannot be cleared fast enough...)

        Parameters:
        maxIoQueueSize - the maximum size of the write queue (default is 10).

      • initializeCellsAsDirty

        default T initializeCellsAsDirty(boolean initializeAsDirty)
        Specify whether cells initialized by a CellLoader should be marked as dirty. It is useful to set this to true if initialization is a costly operation. By this, it is made sure that cells are initialized only once, and then written and retrieved from Imaris when they are next required.

        This is false by default.

        This option only has an effect for ImarisCachedCellImg that are created with a CellLoader (ImarisCachedCellImgFactory.create(long[], CellLoader)).

        Parameters:
        initializeAsDirty - whether cells initialized by a CellLoader should be marked as dirty.

      • persistOnLoad

        default T persistOnLoad(boolean persistOnLoad)
        Specify whether cells initialized by a CellLoader should be immediately persisted to Imaris. It is useful to set this to true for images that are lazily populated by a CellLoader representing the result of some image processing operation. In this scenario, the image is usually fully populated through the CellLoader by touching a pixel in each cell, followed by persisting the whole image to Imaris. It makes sense then, to immediately start writing computed blocks to overlap computation and persisting.

        This is false by default.

        This option only has an effect for ImarisCachedCellImg that are created with a CellLoader (ImarisCachedCellImgFactory.create(long[], CellLoader)).

        Note that it doesn't make much sense to use this with #initializeCellsAsDirty: by definition newly initialized cells will by clean because they are immediately persisted to backing storage.

        Parameters:
        persistOnLoad - whether cells initialized by a CellLoader should be immediately persisted to Imaris.
